Text: Wishing everyone a happy and healthy New Year!
Wishing everyone a happy and safe New Year celebration tonight. Whatever your plans may be, please celebrate responsibly and don’t drink and drive.
Saddened to learn of Barbara Walters’ passing. She was a pioneer for women journalists and had a truly remarkable career. My thoughts are with her friends, family and loved ones.

Congress last week passed (and President Biden signed) a bill to update standards for personal care products like shampoo, deodorant & cosmetics – the first safety update since 1938! Proud we got this bill passed to protect consumers from toxic chemicals.

https://t.co/rwHzaPZnXX

Very pleased that Congress reauthorized the Trafficking Victims Protection Act last week. For more than two decades, this landmark law has provided much-needed resources to law enforcement and nonprofits around the country to prevent human trafficking and protect survivors.
Wishing a happy Kwanzaa to all celebrating this week!
Wishing everyone celebrating Christmas a very happy holiday!

California won big in this year’s government funding bill. It includes robust funding for several issues important to our state such as fighting wildfires, mitigating drought, ending homelessness and combating climate change.

https://t.co/2DjQsov2a1

Yesterday’s 6.4 earthquake in Northern California is a good reminder to all Californians to review your emergency preparation plans. Secure your home. Be sure to have an emergency kit packed. 

Find more info on earthquake preparedness here: https://t.co/oMS3nkseQr

Personal care products like shampoo, deodorant and cosmetics are inextricable parts of Americans’ daily lives. Yet the law governing their safety standards hasn’t been updated in more than 80 years. I’m delighted we will finally update it this week.

https://t.co/0yg9ktCUgR

I’m excited our bill to phase out harmful drift gillnets was included in the omnibus and will become law. We must be better stewards of our oceans and fisheries and help transition the fishing industry to more sustainable and profitable alternatives.

https://t.co/WP1q4vhywH

I’m monitoring the situation in Northern California following this morning’s earthquake and will be sharing resources to assist those in need as they become available. This is a good reminder for all Californians to review their earthquake preparedness.
Wishing everyone celebrating in California and all around the world a very happy Hanukkah!

The defense bill contains funding critical to bolstering California’s water infrastructure. It will help protect waterways, improve and maximize flood control and water storage, prevent stormwater pollution and advance important restoration projects.

https://t.co/HDAmpfHzeq

https://t.co/rTNPH2zsgn

We passed legislation this year with significant money for climate-smart agriculture. As the West’s megadrought continues to hurt farmers, I joined @SenAlexPadilla and our Western colleagues in calling on the USDA to use that funding to also address drought. https://t.co/YocdnHKNOu
It was a pleasure to meet with San Francisco DA Brooke Jenkins earlier this week to discuss public safety and ways we can best support local partners in law enforcement.

I worked closely with President Biden when he was in the Senate to pass the first Assault Weapons Ban. I remain hopeful that one day soon we’ll reinstate that law because it worked. It saved lives. Now, 10 years later, we owe it to the children and families of Newtown to do so.

The common thread between so many mass shootings is the use of military-style assault weapons. Since the Assault Weapons Ban expired in 2004, these weapons have proliferated across the country, all for the profit of gun manufacturers and the gun lobby.

https://t.co/lGzZHjh1SU

As we reflect on the Sandy Hook massacre, let’s remember these children should be in high school today. They should be thinking about college and their future. Instead, 20 innocent children and six educators were brutally murdered by someone armed with AR-15 style assault weapon. https://t.co/kDyHVZjKWq
Today is a historic day. Marriage equality has been reaffirmed, giving families peace of mind knowing their marriages will be protected by federal law. https://t.co/sbZz85h5ae
Happy 386th birthday @USNationalGuard!  Thank you for keeping California and our nation safe and secure.

This incredible achievement — conducted at California’s Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory — is a historic scientific breakthrough and key milestone for fusion research. To everyone involved on this project, great work!
Congratulations Mayor Bass! This is a terrific moment for Los Angeles and I can’t wait to work with you in this new role.

This bill will finish the job, allowing funds generated by any easements on campus to help build housing for homeless veterans. This is another step in our mission to repurpose the West LA VA campus, address homelessness and ensure veterans receive the care they deserve.

Congressman Lieu and I enacted a law last year allowing the VA to use funds generated on the West LA VA campus for new veteran housing, but the portion of that bill giving easement revenue the same treatment was not included.

https://t.co/TNgmbG989y

Destructive anti-satellite missile tests create space debris that threatens astronauts and vital satellites. @RepTedLieu and I introduced a resolution supporting the Biden administration’s efforts to ban these dangerous anti-satellite missile tests worldwide.

We introduced this bill after the Conception boat fire claimed 34 lives. We can’t allow victims of future tragedies to be forgotten. I look forward to the Senate passing this bill soon.

https://t.co/2WBMqqg4BP

I’m glad the House passed our bill today allowing victims of maritime tragedies to receive compensation from those responsible. Owners of small passenger vessels found to be legally responsible for damages should be liable.

Today is #LatinaEqualPayDay marking how much longer, on average, a Latina woman must work to earn the same as a white man last year. This means Latinas earn only 54 cents for every dollar a white man is paid. It’s unacceptable and needs to be rectified.

Thank you to The Science Coalition for naming me a Champion of Science! 

California is home to some of the best research labs in the world and I’m proud to support them in any way I can.

Very pleased to hear Brittney Griner has been released from Russian prison and I join in welcoming her home. I’m thankful that President Biden is doing all he can to return wrongfully detained Americans from abroad and I stand ready to support his administration’s efforts.

Great news! Very happy that the House passed the Respect for Marriage Act, sending our legislation to the president’s desk. We’ve been working on this legislation for years and I look forward to President Biden enacting it into law.

This is a huge step forward in California’s efforts to achieve 100 percent carbon-free electricity. This week’s offshore wind lease sale—the first in the Pacific—is a major milestone in our energy transition and our path to net-zero emissions.

The Western United States has been in the midst of a mega drought for more than two decades. I joined a bipartisan group to highlight the dire need for USDA to support Western farmers. This is some of the most productive farmland in the country and must be protected.

The bravery displayed by American service members 81 years ago today at Pearl Harbor will never be forgotten. We’re forever grateful to those who sacrificed their lives in defense of our country. #PearlHarborRememberanceDay

Antisemitism is dangerous for everyone – history teaches us that antisemitism doesn’t only threaten Jewish people but frequently grows to threaten marginalized communities. Amid a recent rise in antisemitism, it’s incumbent on EVERYONE to condemn hatred and bigotry.

I’m forever grateful to the law enforcement members who protected the Capitol on January 6, 2021. Today’s Congressional Gold Medal Ceremony is just a small sign of our endless gratitude. It can’t be said enough: Thank you to all who defended the Capitol that day and every day.

I strongly agree with the U.S. Conference of Mayors and appreciate their support of my legislation to ban assault weapons. Read this letter from mayors across the country whose cities have experienced mass shootings:

https://t.co/c7pscvKNT9

It’s been seven years since 14 Californians lost their lives in a senseless mass shooting in San Bernardino. On today’s anniversary, my thoughts are with the families and loved ones of everyone affected by this tragedy.

We’ve made tremendous progress in the fight against HIV/AIDS. But access to treatment and accurate information to combat stigma remains just as important as when we started this fight. On #WorldAIDSDay, let’s recommit to finding a cure and eradicating HIV/AIDS once and for all.

Congress must include advanced appropriations for the Indian Health Service in any end-of-year government-funding bill. We can’t allow budget delays and political games to affect anyone’s health care. We must ensure the Indian Health Service is funded.

The receding Salton Sea threatens the health of neighboring communities as toxic elements like arsenic and selenium are exposed and spread by strong desert winds. The $250 million provided by the Biden administration will help reduce the toxic dust that threatens public health.

With the Senate back from the Thanksgiving holiday, it’s time to pass the Respect for Marriage Act. I look forward to voting yes on final passage of the bill later today and encourage all my colleagues to do the same.

Getting updated COVID vaccine & flu shots will help protect you and your family this winter. More than 35 million Americans have already gotten their updated COVID shot. The vaccines is free, easy, safe and effective. Don’t wait. Visit https://t.co/me6nAehiut for more info.
I’d like to wish a very happy Thanksgiving to all. I hope you’re able to spend time with your families and be thankful for those best things in your lives. Happy Thanksgiving!

Heartbroken to hear of yet another mass shooting, this time in Colorado Springs. This trend of hatred and violence targeting the LGBTQ+ community must stop.

Before adjourning at the end of the year, Congress must pass permanent protections for DACA recipients and end the constant fear that DACA could be ended. Dreamers are Americans, period. This is the only home they’ve known and they deserve peace of mind.

She has been an amazing Speaker and her leadership will be greatly missed, especially in our shared home of San Francisco. https://t.co/NOSp4wV0y0

Speaker Pelosi’s decision to step aside as House Democratic leader is personally very difficult for me because she has done so much good for the country and for women. I’m proud to call her a friend and look forward to continuing to work with her, here in Congress and back home.

After years of negotiation, I’m delighted the Senate last night passed our bill to expand research into marijuana-derived medications, finally sending this bill to the president’s desk.

https://t.co/zVjwo76d8q

We’re on the cusp of removing the discriminatory Defense of Marriage Act from the books and ensuring same-sex and interracial marriages remain protected. We must protect the legal rights of married couples and their families.

We can’t let the rights of married couples and their families be put in jeopardy. I’ve championed the Respect for Marriage Act for years, but its need became more urgent after a conservative SCOTUS justice indicated a willingness to overturn Obergefell. This bill is a no-brainer.

Congratulations to @NASA and everyone involved with the successful liftoff of the Artemis I mission last night! This launch marks a renewed American enthusiasm for space exploration, and I can’t wait to see the next step in the Artemis program.

In the year since President Biden signed the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law, communities are already seeing benefits. We’re repairing roads, expanding sustainable transportation options, improving access to clean water and much, much more.

It’s time to remove the shameful Defense of Marriage Act from the books and ensure that same-sex and interracial marriages are protected regardless of the conservative Supreme Court’s actions.

Hate has no place in California. I’m proud to stand with the Los Angeles Human Rights Commission against all forms of hatred and bigotry and to help create a community based on respect and equality.
Wishing a happy Veterans Day to all who served! Thank you for your commitment and dedication to protecting the United States.

Happy 247th birthday Marines! Wishing all members of the Marine Corps a great day. Semper Fidelis!

It’s been four years since a mass shooting in Thousand Oaks took the lives of 12 innocent Californians. Gun violence is a scourge on American society and as we remember those lost that day, we must remain committed to ending the plague of violence that guns enable.

We have seen tremendous progress, but we still have work to do. I’ll continue to advocate for women’s rights in all aspects of life, I’ll continue to advocate for more women leaders and I will continue to do all I can to represent the people of California. https://t.co/uX3u84xzXq

It’s been a pleasure to watch more and more women walk the halls of the Senate. We went from two women senators to 24 today – and I know that number will keep climbing. We have a woman vice president and a woman presidential candidate who won the popular vote.
It’s an incredible honor to become the longest-serving woman senator in our nation’s history, and I’m forever grateful to the people of California who sent me here to represent them.

California is lucky to be home to multiple national laboratories on the cutting-edge of scientific research. I applaud the Biden administration’s announcement of more than $330 million to support work in California’s national labs, especially in the field of clean energy!

As we learn more about the motives, I hope this serves as a reminder that all of us in public life and commenting about public officials should tone down the political rhetoric and avoid fueling division and violence – particularly during the heightened tension of this election.
I was shocked to learn that Paul Pelosi was attacked last night in his San Francisco home. My thoughts are with him, Speaker Pelosi and their family while he recovers.

Armed with an AR-15-style assault weapon and driven by antisemitic lies and conspiracies, four years ago today a gunman murdered 11 people at a Jewish synagogue. As we remember those lost, it’s incumbent upon everyone to stand up to the bigotry that fueled this tragedy.

As the holiday season approaches, it’s imperative to get boosted with the updated vaccine. We’ve seen winter surges over the last two years, but this updated vaccine will offer a new level of protection. Don’t wait any longer, get boosted ASAP.

From raising the age to purchase assault weapons to expanding red-flag laws to passing the Assault Weapons Ban, we must do more to prevent this senseless violence.

My thoughts are with everyone affected by yesterday’s tragedy – students, teachers, families and friends.

Despite recent challenges, California’s economy keeps growing stronger. 

Our state GDP is set to pass Germany to become the fourth-largest economy in the world behind Japan, China and the United States. 

California’s future is brighter than ever.
